comment.author: 34301718@N06
comment._content: Picture is taken in Stalheimskleivane: www.google.no/search?q=Stalheimskleivane www.nettavisen.no/innenriks/article1258766.ece (check brake & clutch before entering :) The road is still open, but the main road is going through a tunnel. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_route_E16

comment.author: 34302166@N04
comment._content: This is not a part of Hardangerfjord. The road between Voss and Stalheim continues down the Naeroydalen valley and ends in Gudvangen. This is where Naeroyfjord starts (UNESCO World Heritage). Naeroyfjord is a branch of the longest fjord in Norway, Sognefjord (204 km long). Check out www.naeroyfjord.com

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Nærøydalen – Then and Now (100+ years later) The road is now paved ... but looks to be just as steep and banked.          "Stalheimskleiva (2011)   by Pheeling                 "Naerodalen (c.1900)"   by Detroit Publishing
